New Records: Rohit Sharma has made 217 runs in 147 balls over his last two trips to the crease.
Babar Azam has scored more runs than anybody in the phase of play between overs 11 and 40 since the last World Cup.
Key Match Events: India bowled out Pakistan for 191, with Kuldeep Yadav and Jasprit Bumrah taking key wickets.
Rohit Sharma scored 86 off 98 balls, his 20th ODI century.
Shreyas Iyer scored 48 not out, helping India win the match by 7 wickets.
Virat Kohli was dismissed for 27 by Hasan Ali.
Shubman Gill was dismissed for 23 by Shadab Khan.
Mohammad Rizwan was dismissed for 52 by Jasprit Bumrah.
Babar Azam was dismissed for 49 by Mohammed Siraj.
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma said that India will look to pick a horses for courses XI and that they shouldn’t take it personally if they’re left out.
Babar Azam said that Pakistan have brought structure to their game and are committed to a style of play that they’ve called “the Pakistan way”.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma praised the team’s performance and said that they were ruthless in their approach.
Shreyas Iyer said that the team was happy with the win and that it was a great team effort.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a flat pitch at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.
The crowd was mostly Indian, with a few Pakistanis in attendance.
The match was broadcast in the USA on ESPN+.
